title: CIA director, on secret trip to Ukraine, hears plan for war’s endgame
description: During meetings in Kyiv, CIA Director William Burns was told of Ukraine’s ambitious goal to retake territory and push Moscow into talks by the end of the year.

title: How the killing of a teen fits into France’s history of police brutality
description: The shooting of Nahel M., a 17-year-old boy this week, is the latest example of violence by French police, which has stoked anger and calls for accountability.

title: Satellite imagery shows what could be Wagner’s future camp in Belarus
description: Hundreds of tents were rapidly built to house thousands at an abandoned military base. Whether it’s the mercenary group’s new home is an open question.

title: How the police killing of a teen sparked a crisis in France
description: France has been gripped by a national crisis as unrest spreads in the aftermath of the fatal shooting of a 17-year-old by a police officer.

title: Court votes to bar Bolsonaro from running for office
description: A majority on the panel found the former president's false claims about voting fraud led thousands of supporters to storm Brasilia Jan. 8 in hopes of overturning his election loss.

title: Macron readies response as France plunged into crisis by police killing of teen
description: Emmanuel Macron is expected to announce emergency measures, after France was rocked by protests for a third night, following the death of a teenager at police hands.

title: Prosecutor calls Kevin Spacey a ‘sexual bully’ in London trial
description: Spacey is facing a string of sex offense charges involving four men, which he all “strenuously denies." If convicted, he could face a prison sentence.

title: The racist roots of the rise in migration to Europe this year
description: The Tunisian president embraced a conspiracy theory. Aggression against Black Africans in Tunisia exploded. An exodus followed.

title: Chinese college grads are ‘zombie-style’ on campus. Here’s why.
description: Three years of college under covid, only to emerge to a terrible job market. It's no wonder Chinese graduates are taking “zombie-style” photos of themselves flopped on the grass.

title: Ukraine’s top general, Valery Zaluzhny, wants shells, planes and patience
description: Zaluzhny expressed frustration that Ukraine still has not received modern fighter jets but is expected to rapidly take back territory from the occupying Russians.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Greta Thunberg discusses war’s environmental impact with Zelensky in Kyiv
description: The Swedish activist called the Kakhovka dam collapse "ecocide," while former U.S. vice president Mike Pence also met with the Ukrainian leader.

title: Canada stabbing suspect targeted gender studies class, police say
description: Three people at the University of Waterloo in Ontario were seriously injured in the attack, which police said was "hate-motivated."

title: The battle in Syria that looms behind Wagner’s rebellion
description: The single bloodiest clash between U.S. and Russian forces since the Cold War took place in early February 2018. The mercenaries involved belonged to the Wagner Group, led by the now-exiled Yevgeniy Prigozhin.

title: Evidence mounts for use of banned mines by Ukrainian forces, rights group says
description: The mines in question are considered particularly pernicious and violate international laws of war because they harm soldiers and civilians indiscriminately.

title: Five Guys has opened in South Korea. People went nuts.
description: When the DMV-area burger chain opened its first location in Seoul this week, some people queued overnight and even tried to re-sell the burgers at exorbitant prices.

title: Carmen Sevilla, a glamorous queen of Spanish film, dies at 92
description: She rose to stardom as an actress in the 1950s, appeared in a pair of English-language epics and became an affable staple of Spanish television.
